Description:
You will be given a JSON object representing a query. Your task is to:

Analyze the text in the query field.

Detect all types of negation present based on this taxonomy:

Sentential negation (e.g., "not", "no", "never")

Exclusionary negation (e.g., "except", "besides")

Affixal negation (e.g., prefixes like "un-", "dis-")

Implicit negation (verbs or words implying negation like "deny", "refuse")

Contrasting antonyms (pairs of antonyms implying negation)

For each negation detected, return:

The type name from the taxonomy

The character span in the query or document text (if applicable)

A confidence score from 0 to 1 reflecting your certainty

Indicate with a boolean flag is_negated if any negation is present.

Return:

A list of detected negation types and related info

The boolean "is_negated" field

 A textual explanation of the negation(s) detected, if any
